document.bingtitle: CoCo Joe’s is now open – Comings and Goings - Rockford, IL ...
document.webtitle: CoCo Joes is now openComings and Goings - Rockford, IL - Rockford Register Star
document.description: Whether it's a new boutique popping up, a fast-food restaurant ... No have a nice day No Im sorry an no receipt ... on Coco Joe’s restaurant opens in Loves Park
document.body:

Local Loop Reader Content Daily Deals People Living Spaces Branded Content Comings and Goings Keep track of the latest business openings and closings. Whether it's a new boutique popping up, a fast-food restaurant closing down or a progress report on a major development, you'll find all the latest bits of information here. See something while you're out and about? Leave a comment or send an e-mail to business@rrstar.com and we'll check it out. Read more Follow @mlwestphal Skip to content CoCo Joe’s is now open Posted on November 23, 2009 at 12:19 pm by Melissa Westphal Tweet CoCo Joe’s, 4410 Charles St., is open for business, and the menu features sandwiches like Italian beef and tenderloins, burgers, wraps, Chicago-style hot dogs, salads and ice cream. Hours as of now are 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. It’s in the former Dairy Queen building near Heartland Community Church.
Joe Pendergrass and his sons, Matt and Mike, are in charge of the venture. They also own and run the nearby Sports Page Bar&Grill.
Related posts:
Dairy Queen closes This entry was posted in Uncategorized and tagged openings . Bookmark the permalink . ← Former KFC building on Charles torn down Educators of Beauty school moving to new site → 7 Comments
FrankyG says: November 23, 2009 at 6:47 pm AWESOME! ryan says: December 4, 2009 at 2:56 pm I like this blog, kinda wish it was updated more! I’m wondering if you have any updates on a place called Oriental Dragon Sushi Bar….I saw it while I was driving down Perryville…it’s in that shopping center with Hollywood Video and Jimmy John’s near Woodman’s. Any word? Melissa Westphal says: December 4, 2009 at 3:31 pm Ryan—Thanks for your feedback! I’m glad you like the blog, and I’ll try to post more often for you. I actually have a call into First Rockford Group about Oriental Dragon, so check back. Hope to have something more on that soon. Ms Cake says: December 7, 2009 at 6:09 pm CoCo Joe\’s has really good food–you won\’t be disappointed if you go there! So glad something moved into the old Dairy Queen spot, because that was such a nice location for that neighborhood. james Rockford says: September 3, 2010 at 2:22 pm I finally decided to stop and try this place out. WOW! what a disapointment. I ordered a large choc. dipped cone. The girl that served it looked like she just got done shopping at fredrick of hollywood and bought out the entire walmart jewlery counter. She hands me this 3inch cone with 10inches of icecream on top with this water down chocolate dip on it, icecream dripping and spewing from all the cracks. I ssaid this doesnt look good, where’s the chocolate? and with a deer in the head lights look says…I dont know and runs off with a pissed off look. comes back with something that sorta looks a little better. unfortunatly I take this mess and pay for it. No have a nice day No Im sorry an no receipt. unfortunatley the chocolate dip wasnt that good and i know have icecream dripping all over me while driving. A real Icecream cone Disater.
Hopefully this isnt they way these guys run their buisness all the time but im kinda guessing it is. well I think ill stick to DQ and skip this place next time.
Im betting this place wont last long. Monica Hampshire says: September 20, 2010 at 9:27 am My boyfriend&I ate at this place last Saturday. Both ordered the everyday special–dbl hamburger w/fries&drink for $3.99 and we both asked for cheese to be added. So we get this to go, are driving down the road start eating our food&no cheese on the burgers. Okay easy enough mistake…except we got charged for it (wasn’t given a receipt either). Food didn’t taste bad but by later that night we didn’t feel that good. The boyfriend felt the worst, I was okay. Finally figured out he must have gotten food poisoning from this place.
I advise not to go here..I certainly won’t be going back! Yuck! kim says: November 24, 2010 at 8:01 pm good food and never had a problem
